items.title: New Report Finds 1% of Sonoma County Residents Account for Over 25% of Jail, Shelter, and Behavioral Health Utilization
items.summary: A new report released today by the California Policy Lab at UC Berkeley helps Sonoma County government leaders to identify and better serve a group of about 6,600 high utilizers of health, justice, and homelessness services provided by state and county agencies.

items.title: Job Opportunities as of July 8, 2020
items.summary: View a list of our current and upcoming job opportunities, including:  - Environmental Health Program Manager - Parks and Grounds Maintenance Worker II - Water Agency Environmental Specialist I

items.title: El Condado de Sonoma expande pruebas de anticuerpos para incluir a los trabajadores esenciales
items.summary: A partir de hoy, la prueba de anticuerpos está disponible para  residentes del Condado de Sonoma que se consideraron trabajadores  esenciales en las primeras etapas de la pandemia de COVID-19.

items.title: County of Sonoma Expands Antibody Testing to Include Essential Workers
items.summary: Beginning today, antibody testing is now available for Sonoma County residents who were considered essential workers in the early stages of the COVID-19 pandemic.

items.title: Junta de Supervisores Creará Oficina de Equidad para el condado de Sonoma
items.summary: La Junta de Supervisores votó unánimemente hoy por la aprobación de una Oficina de Equidad para el condado, con la instrucción de enfocarse de inmediato en el desproporcionado impacto del COVID-19 en las comunidades Latinx e indígenas de la región.

items.title: Board of Supervisors to create Office of Equity for Sonoma County
items.summary: The Board of Supervisors today voted unanimously to approve the creation  of an Office of Equity for the county with instruction to immediately  focus on issues related to the disproportionate impact of COVID-19 on  the Latinx and indigenous communities in the region.

items.title: Permit Sonoma Limited Reopening
items.summary: Permit Sonoma will be reopening for limited services and for limited hours starting July 6, 2020.

items.title: Oficinas del Departamento de Servicios Humanos abren el 6 de julio con medidas de seguridad, horas reducidas y servicios limitados
items.summary: Las oficinas del Departamento de Servicios Humanos del Condado de Sonoma (HSD) abren sus puertas al publico el lunes, 6 de julio 2020, con horas reducidas y servicios limitados. Clientes y empleados aun serán requeridos seguir las medidas de seguridad del Covid-19.

items.title: Human Services Department Lobbies Open July 6with Safety Measures, Limited Hours, Services
items.summary: Sonoma County Human Services Department (HSD) buildings reopen to the public on Monday, July 6, 2020, with limited hours and services. Clients and employees will be required to follow Covid-19 safety procedures.

items.title: New Health Order Aligns County with State; Opens More Business Sectors
items.summary: A new health order, slated to go into effect at 12:01 a.m. Friday, June 19, relaxes more restrictions and allows more businesses and activities to resume.

items.title: Summer Dam Will Not Be Installed at Healdsburg Veterans Memorial Beach
items.summary: Due to impacts of the Covid-19 health emergency and projections for reduced river flows, Sonoma County Regional Parks will not install the summer dam on the Russian River at Healdsburg Veterans Memorial Beach.

items.title: County of Sonoma Expands Antibody Testing to Include Healthcare Workers
items.summary: Beginning today antibody testing is now available for Sonoma County healthcare workers. The County of Sonoma continues to offer antibody testing for first responders, police and fire personnel, and community members who tested positive for COVID-19 at least three weeks ago.

items.title: El Condado de Sonoma Amplía las Pruebas de Anticuerpos para Incluir a Trabajadores de Salud
items.summary: A partir de hoy, las pruebas de anticuerpos ahora están disponibles para los trabajadores de salud del condado de Sonoma. El Condado de Sonoma continúa ofreciendo pruebas de anticuerpos para personal de primeros auxilios, policía y bomberos, y miembros de la comunidad que dieron positivo para COVID-19 hace al menos tres semanas.

items.title: County of Sonoma to Allow Tasting Rooms for Wineries and Breweries to Operate without Serving Food Beginning June 12, 2020
items.summary: The current Shelter-in-Place Health Order will be modified to allow tasting rooms for wineries and breweries to operate without being required to serve food at the same time. Bars and pubs are not included.

items.title: Let’s Work Together to Support Our Older Adult Community During COVID-19 June is Elder Abuse Awareness Month
items.summary: Every year an estimated 5 million, or 1 in 10 older Americans experience physical, mental, and financial elder abuse, neglect, or exploitation. The COVID Crisis has increased isolation for older and dependent adults, likely causing unreported instances of concerns from neighbors and others. Individuals and community-wide prevention efforts and supportive services can help keep older adults safe and healthy, helping stop abuse before it happens.

items.title: State Releases Guidance for Counties with Variance to Move Stage Three at Their Own Discretion
items.summary: California Department of Public Health (CDPH) released guidance for counties with variance, which includes Sonoma County, to go to Stage Three and allow further sectors to operate during the coronavirus pandemic (COVID-19) as soon as Friday June 12, 2020.

items.title: Local Case Data Supports Long Awaited Openings in New Health Order
items.summary: Sonoma County’s Health Officer issued a new Order on today allowing in-person faith based services, indoor retail shopping and dining, hair salons/barbershops, and outdoor recreation business activities and equipment rental.

items.title: Estado Pública Guías para Condados con Variación para Mover a la Etapa Tres a su Propia Discreción
items.summary: Hoy, el Departamento de Salud Pública de California (por sus siglas en inglés, CDPH) publicó una guía para los condados con variación, que incluye el Condado de Sonoma, para pasar a la Etapa Tres y permitir que otros sectores operen durante la pandemia del coronavirus (COVID-19) tan pronto como el viernes 12 de junio de 2020.

items.title: County of Sonoma Begins COVID-19 Antibody Testing for Certain Groups Only
items.summary: Beginning Saturday, June 6, 2020, the County of Sonoma will test certain individuals for antibodies to the novel coronavirus (COVID-19). Testing will be performed daily at the Public Health Lab in Santa Rosa, with plans for strategically expanding this service at select hospitals and health centers in the county.

items.title: El Condado de Sonoma inicia la prueba de anticuerpos COVID-19 solo para ciertos grupos
items.summary: A partir del sábado 6 de junio de 2020, el Condado de Sonoma examinará a ciertos individuos para detectar anticuerpos contra el nuevo coronavirus (COVID-19).

items.title: Se extiende el acceso a los parques en la nueva Orden de Salud
items.summary: El martes la Oficial de Salud del Condado de Sonoma flexibilizó aún más las restricciones relacionadas con la recreación al aire libre durante la pandemia de Covid-19 al emitir una orden que les permite a las entidades a cargo de parques el abrir sus estacionamientos costeros y restablecer las horas diurnas de visita a las playas

items.title: Parks Access Expanded in New Health Order
items.summary: Sonoma County’s health officer on Tuesday further eased restrictions on outdoor recreation during the Covid-19 pandemic by issuing an order that allows park agencies to reopen coastal parking lots and restore daytime visiting hours at beaches.

items.title: Parks Access Expanded in New Health Order
items.summary: Sonoma County’s health officer on Tuesday further eased restrictions on outdoor recreation during the Covid-19 pandemic by issuing an order that allows park agencies to reopen coastal parking lots and restore daytime visiting hours at beaches.

items.title: Draft Substantial Amendment to 2019 Action Plan and Notice of Public Hearing
items.summary: A draft Substantial Amendment to the 2019-2020 Action Plan is now available for public review and comment. The proposed actions are related to use of supplemental Community Development Block Grant (CDBG-CV) and Emergency Solutions Grant (ESG-CV) funds allocated to the County through the CARES Act for use in responding to the impacts of COVID-19.

items.title: Joint Statement from Susan Gorin, Chair of the Sonoma County Board of Supervisors, and Mark Essick, Sonoma County Sheriff/Coroner
items.summary: Together, we are experiencing something not seen in a century – a pandemic that has required the lockdown of our communities, our gathering centers and much of our economy. Today, we are faced with the daunting task of how best to phase in the reopening of our communities, while respecting the fact that the challenges faced by each and every one of us is unique.

items.title: Public Notice-Recology Sonoma Marin Facility May 28 2020
items.summary: The Sonoma County Environmental Health Department, Solid Waste Management Program, Acting As The Local Enforcement Agency (Lea) Is Certified By The Department Of Resources Recycling And Recovery (Calrecycle) To Enforce State Laws And Regulations At Solid Waste Sites Within Its Jurisdiction.
